channel.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s
item.description:
@n3ss3s wrote:

[quote=“yo123, post:3, topic:406905”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=503749.msg3687000#msg3687000 date=1311904890]
If they use reflection why the fuck are they still going through jni overhead just to use a terrible 50 year old programming language
[/quote]I have no fucking idea. Actually, that question came up and people said it was for legacy reasons – learning a new language would be “too hard” or “too much time” or something. Plus, people there have a weird hate toward Java even though THE MOST IMPORTANT PARTS OF THEIR ALMIGHTY SMART IS IN JAVA… ya

http://villavu.com/forum/showthread.php?t=63510
Have a read of this thread if you’re interested[/quote]

SRL isn’t thriving to be the most efficient and up-to-date botting community, I guess you could call it vintage botting or something… Most of the scripters do it as some sort of a hobby, they know it takes about 20 lines to make a chicken killer for RSBot that buries bones and cooks the meat, but after all that’s not much fun is it? (Well, someone might argue neither is writing 500 lines for the same thing).

Only difference to the end-user (scripter) is the effort they’re willing to put in for the same results. Also, most of the older scripters can make quite a lot more use of their brain than the new RSBuddy scripters whose main concern is making sure their Frost Dragon killer drinks antifires in order not to get shit on, in comparison to people at SRL solving stuff like the gravedigger random entirely in color…

Read full topic
item.source: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:20, topic:406750”]Could they do some sort of Xbootclasspath or w/e hackery to mess around wit Class and ClassLoader to overload the newInstance method and check where it’s being called from?[/quote]and that would be noticed instantly

but i think people not properly understanding classloaders is how jagex would detect bots

Read full topic

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Almost every one of the SRL devs are purely color-only and don’t like reflection scripts at all, no reflection code is in the SRL library at all, and probably never will be. So it’s not like they are ALL reflection.

Read full topic

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“yo123, post:1, topic:406905”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=503749.msg3686633#msg3686633 date=1311889782]

who seriously uses colour to macro now?

Lots of people:
http://villavu.com/forum/index.php
[/quote]
Um, most scripts use reflection now. The color ones either suck / are inaccurate or are 30 years outdated.[/quote]

2011-1999 = 12

Color-based RS bots were outdated 18 years before the game

wut

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

mutex_:

Did someone actually make a sound-based bot? unlimitedorb mentioned the idea; it’d be quite interesting to see how that’d play out.

I know the guys on SRL were working on one, Fawaki and Wizzup? at least, there was some work to integrate sound support into SCAR as well back in the day, I don’t know what happened to it though.

Read full topic
item.source: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?

item.title: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:8, topic:406750”][quote author=Newty link=topic=503749.msg3685810#msg3685810 date=1311830057]
Frell the only reason rs is so susceptible to bots is because (as stated in previous threads) their game mechanics make botting worthwhile, whereas games like WoW have game mechanics that deter the effectiveness of botting.
[/quote]Uhm… grinding until max level is a pretty sound argument for botting. And there ARE a fuckton of bots in WoW as well.

The only game design that deters botting is the freeform pvp, full loot model.[/quote]

This. And infact this doesn’t even deter botting. It just deters bot development… there will always be demand for bots and cheats in every online game as we live in a society where the current generation demands everything for nothing.

Read full topic
item.source: Would bots still work if the game was permanently fullscreen?

item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Frell the only reason rs is so susceptible to bots is because (as stated in previous threads) their game mechanics make botting worthwhile, whereas games like WoW have game mechanics that deter the effectiveness of botting.

Jagex will never be rid of the bot problem for that reason.
